newsitem.title: FRANCE: Fish shipments continue to boost Brest air cargo.
newsitem.headline: Fish shipments continue to boost Brest air cargo.

text.p: Brest's Guipavas airport said it handled 1,864 tonnes of cargo traffic in January-July 1996, an increase of 21.6 percent on the same period last year.

"One of the main factors in the growth in traffic continues to be the buoyant demand for fish and seafood exports from Brittany to Paris, the south of France and Corsica," an airline official at Brest Airport told Reuters.
The fish shipments are mainly carried on Air France Europe scheduled passenger flights from Brest to Paris and from there to Nice and Marseille and Corsica, the official added.
January-July 1996 postal traffic handled at Brest Airport was up 1.6 percent on the first seven months of last year at 1,141 tonnes, the airport authority said.

French airline, L'Aeropostale, carries overnight mail between its Paris-Charles-de-Gaulle hub and Brest on a regular basis using a five-tonne capacity Fokker 27 aircraft. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
